file.name: programmable-network.yaml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.3
# This is an automatically-generated document. Please submit changes to
# pnapi-support@team.telstra.com
info:
  title: Telstra Programmable Network API
  description: >-
    Telstra Programmable Network is a self-provisioning platform that allows its
    users to create on-demand connectivity services between multiple end-points
    and add various network functions to those services. Programmable Network
    enables to connectivity to a global ecosystem of networking services as well
    as public and private cloud services. Once you are connected to the platform
    on one or more POPs (points of presence), you can start creating those
    services based on the use case that you want to accomplish. The Programmable
    Network API is available to all customers who have registered to use the
    Programmable Network.

    To register, please contact your account representative.
  version: 2.5.3
  contact:
    name: Telstra Corporation - Programmable Network API
    url: "https://dev.telstra.com/content/programmable-network-api"
    email: pnapi-support@team.telstra.com
servers:
  - url: "https://api.pn.telstra.com"
    description: Production Public API
components:
  securitySchemes:
    oAuth2:
      type: oauth2
      description: OAuth 2 with password grant flow
      flows:
        password:
          tokenUrl: https://api.pn.telstra.com/1.0.0/auth/generatetoken
          scopes: {}
  schemas:
    contractresponse-fragment:
      type: object
      properties:
        params:
          type: object
          properties:
            duration:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/duration.secs'
            bandwidth:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/bandwidth.kbs"
            linkid:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/linkid"
            contractid:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/contractid"
            currencyId:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/currencyID"
            price:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/price"
            renewal-option:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/renewal-option"

    custacct-base:
      allOf:
        - type: object
          properties:
            phone:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Phone number to be associated with the company/division/group
                this customer tenancy represents
            address:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Primary address for the company/division/group this customer
                tenancy represents
              example: "150 Lonsdale St."
            city:
              type: string
              description: >-
                The city for the location of the company/division/group
                this customer tenancy represents
              example: "Melbourne"
            fax:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Fax number to be associated with the company/division/group
                this customer tenancy represents
            website:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Web URL to be associated with the company/division/group
                this customer tenancy represents
              example: "http://www.example.com"
            enforce2FA:
              type: boolean
              description: >-
                Flag indicating whether two-factor authentication is
                enforced for the users of this customer tenancy
              example: false
            customertype:
              type: string
              description: >-
                A description of the billing status of this customer
              example: "External Paying"
            postalcode:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Postal code of the location of the company/division/group
                this customer tenancy represents
            partnercode:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Code referring to the partner through which the customer
                tenancy was purchased
              example: "ACME"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-nonconsenting"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-companyname"

    custacct-robase:
      allOf:
        - type: object
          properties:
            currency:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Currency in which resources created in this customer tenancy
                will be billed
              example: "AUD"
            status:
              type: string
              description: Internal use
              example: "1"
            parentcompanyuuid:
              type: string
              description: Unique identifier of the parent customer tenancy
              example: "c2d7358d-d46f-4e2b-8472-0882d6edda1c"
            parentcustomeraccountid:
              description: >-
                Account identifier of the parent customer
              type: string
              example: "1234"
            parentcompanyname:
              type: string
              description: >-
                Company Name associated with the parent customer tenancy
                for this customer tenancy (provided for convenience and
                used for display/reference purposes only)
              example: "TPN Demo"
            createdon:
              description: Date on which this customer was created
              example: 1535956880000
              type: integer
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-companyuuid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-customeraccountid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-domainid"

    custacct-countrystate:
      type: object
      properties:
        state:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Abbreviation for the political state associated with the
            company/division/group this customer tenancy represents
          example: "VIC"
        country:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Three-letter country code of the location of the
            company/division/group this customer tenancy represents
          example: "AUS"
        statename:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Name of the political state associated with the
            company/division/group this customer tenancy represents
          example: "Victoria"
        countryname:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Country Name associated with this customer tenancy
          example: "Australia"

    custacct-custextra:
      type: object
      properties:
        idp_type:
          type: string
          description: >-
            "Indicates the Identity Provider type. Currently, the
            possible values are: 'Default' for the Programmable
            Network Identity Provider, 'saml' for an external
            Identity Provider using the SAML standard, and 'oauth'
            for an external Identity Provider using the OAuth
            standard"
          example: "Default"
        partnerchannel:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Channel that the customer tenancy belongs to
          example: "International"

    custacct-companyuuid:
      type: object
      properties:
        companyuuid:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Unique identifier for this customer tenancy
          example: "9bbfc3a8-f32c-4658-8a81-513274ae25f0"

    custacct-companyname:
      type: object
      properties:
        companyname:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Name of the company/division/group this customer tenancy
            represents
          example: "Engineering Division"

    custacct-customeraccountid:
      type: object
      properties:
        customeraccountid:
          type: string
          description: >-
            An account identifier provided by the creator of the customer

    custacct-domainid:
      type: object
      properties:
        domainid:
          type: string
          description: >-
            The domain identifier for this customer tenancy, used
            for authenticating users to this customer tenancy
          example: "714635132656"

    custacct-nonconsenting:
      type: object
      properties:
        nonconsenting:
          type: string
          description: Internal use
          example: "null"

    custacct-billingaccountid:
      type: object
      properties:
          billingaccountid:
            type: string
            description: >-
              Billing account identifier for the parent customer of this
              customer tenancy, used for billing purposes
            example: "4099099282"

    custacct-billingaccountuuid:
      type: object
      properties:
        billingaccountuuid:
          type: string
          example: "3008ef0b-7f5e-44c0-9ab5-13d07a4acee8"
          description: >-
            Unique identifier for the billing account used by this
            customer tenancy

    createcustomerrequest:
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-base"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-billingaccountid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-countrystate"
        - required:
          - address
          - city
          - country
          - currency
          - companyname
          - customertype
          - customeraccountid
          - parentcompanyuuid
          - billingaccountid

    updatecustomerrequest:
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-base"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-countrystate"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-custextra"

    customerdetails:
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-base"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-robase"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-countrystate"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-custextra"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-billingaccountid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-billingaccountuuid"

    accountdetails:
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-base"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-robase"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-countrystate"

    childcustomerdetails:
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-base"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-robase"

    childcustomer:
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-companyuuid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-companyname"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-customeraccountid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-domainid"
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/custacct-nonconsenting"
        - type: object
          properties:
            tags:
              type: array
              items: 
                type: string
            childs:
              type: array
              items:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/childcustomer"

    topotagupdaterequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        name:
          type: string
          description: >-
            A short human-friendly name which is visible in the UI to
            select the topology
          example: "Production WAN Updated Name"
        description:
          description: >-
            A longer human-friendly description which is visible in the
            UI when looking at the topology detail.
          type: string
          example: "Updated topology for WAN"
    backuprequest:
      required:
        - vnf_uuid
        - backup_name
      type: object
      properties:
        vnf_uuid:
          description: UUID of the VNF to back up
          type: string
          example: "303c6928-f9de-4e4c-a563-4772775f2316"
        backup_name:
          description: Name of the backup to display to the end user
          type: string
          example: "prior to production network reconfiguration"
        replace_backup_uuid:
          description: >-
            UUID of an existing backup to replace, if this backup is successful
          type: string
          example: "736848ab-d4dc-4f94-a255-35f9984f8a42"
    topotagcreaterequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        name:
          description: >-
            A short human-friendly name which is visible in the UI to
            select the topology
          type: string
          example: "Production WAN"
        description:
          description: >-
            A longer human-friendly description which is visible in the
            UI when looking at the topology detail.
          type: string
          example: "Main topology for WAN"
    rebootrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        reboot_type:
          description: Identifies whether a warm or cold reboot is required
          type: string
          example: "cold"
    regvportrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        vporttype:
          description: >-
            Identifies whether the vport relates to a full port
            (i.e. no VLANs) or a single VLAN. Values=vlan|port
          type: string
          example: "vlan"
        endpointuuid:
          description: UUID of the endpoint for which the VPORT is to be created
          type: string
          example: "9a04a7ff-0a82-4259-9f2b-c384b6d720ab"
        vportvalue:
          description: if the vporttype is "VLAN", provides the VLAN details
          type: object
          properties:
            vlan:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/vlan"
    vportrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        customeruuid:
          description: >-
            Unique identifier representing the customer who owns the VNF
          type: string
          example: "e58af39b-4a89-43f2-b1ed-1816b6d1f8e9"
        vnfuuid:
          description: >-
            UUID representing the VNF on which the vport will be created
          type: string
          example: "9da748fb-9044-4909-95c2-4245d7592bec"
        management_port:
          description: >-
            TBC
          type: boolean
    createcontractrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        duration:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/duration.hrs"
        bandwidth:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/bandwidth.mbs"
        renewal-option:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/renewal-option"
    createlinkrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        billing-id:
          description: >-
            UUID of the billing account the link will be charged to
          type: string
          example: "684903a3-78b0-4005-9bfe-eece54ad42f3"
        description:
          description: >-
            A human-friendly description which is visible in the
            UI when looking at the link detail.
          type: string
          example: >-
            "Replication link between Equinix SYD and NextDC MEL"
        connections:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/connections"
        tag:
          description: >-
            A short label specified by customer
          type: string
          example: "prod"
        latency:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/latency"
        duration:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/duration.secs'
        bandwidth:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/bandwidth.kbs"
        renewal-option:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/renewal-option"
        link-type:
          description: "1=VLAN, 2=VNF"
          type: integer
          example: 1
        topology_tag_uuid:
          description: >-
            UUID representing the topology tag to be assigned to the link
          type: string
          example: "684903a3-78b0-4005-9bfe-eece54ad42f3"
    endpointupdaterequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        name:
          description: >-
            A short human-friendly name which is visible in the UI under
            the endpoint icon
          type: string
          example: "My Endpoint"
    assigntopotagrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        topology_tag:
          description: >-
            UUID representing the topology tag to be assigned to the endpoint
          type: string
          example: "38d17228-0179-491f-9e84-36ddd078b8e6"
    regendpointrequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        customeruuid:
          type: string
          example: "6a607f5f-25c9-45a1-a960-a34245509208"
          description: >-
            Unique identifier representing the customer who will own the
            endpoint
        datacenteruuid:
          type: string
          example: "dc8f4a57-4621-4b17-87bd-e5a7e508bf7a"
          description: >-
            UUID of the data centre which the port is to be allocated from
        interfacetype:
          description: Type of physical port required
          externalDocs:
            description: List of port types
            url: "https://dev.telstra.com/content/programmable-network-api/#section/Master-Data/Interface-Types"
          type: string
          example: "1000Base-TX"
    vnfendpointrequest:
      required:
        - name
        - customeruuid
        - imageuuid
        - flavoruuid
        - datacenteruuid
        - config
      type: object
      properties:
        name:
          description: Label describing the VNF to display to the end user
          type: string
          example: "Border Firewall"
        customeruuid:
          type: string
          example: "e66546d2-eb85-442f-a4d4-a4f6f4cee6bc"
          description: >-
            Unique identifier representing the customer who will own
            the endpoint
        imageuuid:
          description: >-
            Identifier from image list representing the VNF image
          type: integer
          example: 21
        flavoruuid:
          description: >-
            Identifier from image list representing the VNF instance type
          type: integer
          example: 22
        datacenteruuid:
          type: string
          example: "2e5ff2d1-da1b-4e5d-81a8-58f1780b1031"
          description: >-
            UUID of the data centre which the VNF is to be deployed in
        config:
          description: "Boot configuration for VNF, base64 encoded"
          type: string
          example: ""
        topology_tag_uuid:
          description: >-
            UUID of the topology that should be tagged against the VNF
          type: string
          example: "f6c14b31-f29f-4be2-919b-5b7f463e4a3c"
    Error:
      type: object
      properties:
        ns:
          type: string
          xml:
            name: "xmlns:ams"
            attribute: true
        error-code:
          type: integer
          example: 1010099
          xml:
            name: "ams:error-code"
        error-message:
          type: string
          xml:
            name: "ams:error-message"
        error-auxiliary:
          type: string
          xml:
            name: "ams:error-auxiliary"
      xml:
        name: "ams:error"
    success-fragment:
      type: object
      properties:
        success-auxiliary:
          type: string
          example: "success"
        success-code:
          type: integer
          example: 20000
        success-message:
          type: string
          example: "vport created successfully"
    endpoint-port:
      type: object
      properties:
        cabletype:
          description: "Physical cable medium required to connect to this port"
          type: string
          example: "SMF"
        connectortype:
          description: >-
            Type of phyisical connector required to connect to this port
          type: string
          example: "LC"
        cfa:
          description: >-
            Customer Facility Assignment, or the reference ID for the
            physical port within the DC for interconnect
          type: string
          example: "10GBase-LR SMF/LC"
        endpointuuid:
          description: "Unique identifier for this endpoint"
          type: string
          example: "8843fd24-4ef6-4a7d-8241-aed3778d6f07"
        interfacespeed:
          description: "Speed at which the physical interface operates"
          type: string
          example: "100"
        interfacetype:
          description: "Common name for the standard used on this port"
          type: string
          example: "10GBase-LR"
        vport:
          description: >-
            List of Virtual Ports (or VLANs) which exist on this endpoint
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: "#/components/schemas/vport"
    vport:
      type: object
      properties:
        status:
          description: Current status of the vport
          externalDocs:
            description: List of vport statuses
            url: "https://dev.telstra.com/content/programmable-network-api/#section/Master-Data/Link-Contract-Status-Codes"
          type: string
          example: "deployed"
        bandwidth:
          description: "Bandwidth [TODO: kb/s or mb/s?]"
          type: integer
          example: 0
        interfacesequence:
          description: Sequence number of the interface on a VNF
          type: integer
          example: 0
        customdisplayname:
          description: A label to display to the end user
          type: string
          example: "0"
        vporttype:
          description: >-
            Identifies whether the vport relates to a full port
            (i.e. no VLANs) or a single VLAN. Values=vlan|port
          type: string
          example: "vlan"
        vportuuid:
          description: UUID of the vport
          type: string
          example: "e62716f5-cc68-40e7-b97e-f1e3d1bda9a8"
        vportvalue:
          type: object
          description: if the vporttype is "VLAN", provides the VLAN details
          properties:
            vlan:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/vlan"
    connections:
      description: array of two endpoints for the link
      type: array
      minItems: 2
      maxItems: 2
      example:
        - "5134d2ba-ce81-4b1c-9242-d2f30896c3a0"
        - "e2f182ee-8c06-410d-b0fe-e21c9e7ee7bd"
      items:
        type: string
        description: UUID representing the vport associated with the endpoint
    billing:
      type: object
      properties:
        billingid:
          type: string
          example: "dae2cb75-89f2-4b5b-be99-5cf3ae3faa20"
        billing-account:
          type: string
          example: "60012345"
    role:
      type: object
      properties:
        role-name:
          type: string
          example: "customer-admin"
        permissions:
          type: array
          items:
            type: string
            example: "delete-user"
    vnf-tag:
      type: object
      properties:
        description:
          type: string
          example: "UNIX"
        id:
          type: integer
          example: 2
        name:
          type: string
          example: "UNIX"
    vlan:
      required:
        - id
        - mac
      type: object
      properties:
        id:
          description: VLAN identifier
          type: string
          example: "101"
        mac:
          description: TODO
          type: string
          example: ""
    topology:
      type: object
      properties:
        uuid:
          type: string
          example: "2056dbc6-fcad-4374-9dda-3bde3507b3b3"
        name:
          type: string
          description: >-
            A short human-friendly name which is visible in the UI to
            select the topology
          example: "Production WAN"
        description:
          type: string
          description: >-
            A longer human-friendly description which is visible in the
            UI when looking at the topology detail.
          example: "Main topology for WAN"
        status:
          type: string
          example: "active"
        customer_uuid:
          type: string
          example: "536b8cca-6594-46b9-8e62-1638e42deb6e"
        nsd_uuid:
          description: "no longer used"
          type: string
          example: ""
        guid_topology_id:
          type: string
          example: ""
        created_by:
          type: string
          example: "7a53ecf9-644a-4c92-8c63-eabc1ffe131f"
        creation_date:
          type: integer
          example: 1508307028000
        deletion_date:
          type: integer
          example: 0
    link:
      type: object
      properties:
        description:
          type: string
          example: "Main link from Melbourne to Sydney"
        latency:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/latency"
        linkid:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/linkid"
        contracts:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: "#/components/schemas/contract"
        tag:
          type: string
          example: "prod"
        connections:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/connections"
        type:
          type: string
          example: "0"
        linkStatus:
          type: integer
          example: 1
        billing-id:
          type: string
          example: "b41c4ec8-1825-404b-b740-feaeba96681d"
    duration.secs:
      description: "Duration of contract in seconds"
      type: integer
      example: 3600
      minimum: 3600
    duration.hrs:
      description: "Duration of contract in hours (not seconds)"
      type: integer
      example: 1
      minimum: 1
    bandwidth.kbs:
      description: "Bandwidth in kB/s"
      type: integer
      example: 1000
      minimum: 1000
      maximum: 10000000
    bandwidth.mbs:
      description: "Bandwidth in MB/s (not kB/s)"
      type: integer
      example: 1
      minimum: 1
      maximum: 10000
    renewal-option:
      type: integer
      description: >-
        "Renewal Option: 0=Auto Disconnect, 1=Auto Renew, 2=Pay per hour"
      example: 0
    linkid:
      type: string
      description: "Identifier of a link"
      example: "f070660600c1c45f"
    contractid:
      type: string
      description: "Identifier of a contract"
      example: "f070660600c1c45f.2"
    latency:
      description: "Latency: 0=Low, 1=Standard, 2=Best Effort"
      type: integer
      example: 0
      pattern: "[012]"
    price:
      type: integer
      example: 259
    contractStatus:
      type: integer
      example: 8
    version:
      type: integer
      example: 20431
    deletedtimestamp:
      type: integer
      example: 0
    currencyCode:
      type: string
      example: "USD"
    currencyID:
      type: string
      example: "1"
    contract-start-time:
      type: integer
      example: 1508589922000
    contract-end-time:
      type: integer
      example: 1508593521000
    contract:
      type: object
      properties:
        contractid:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/contractid"
        duration:
          $ref: '#/components/schemas/duration.secs'
        bandwidth:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/bandwidth.kbs"
        price:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/price"
        contractStatus:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/contractStatus"
        version:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/version"
        deletedtimestamp:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/deletedtimestamp"
        currencyCode:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/currencyCode"
        currencyID:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/currencyID"
        renewal-option:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/renewal-option"
        contract-start-time:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/contract-start-time"
        contract-end-time:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/contract-end-time"
    visitcard:
      type: object
      properties:
        uuid:
          type: string
          example: "44aac063-3437-4781-96e9-63610d659afb"
          readOnly: true
          description: UUID of the Visit Card
        provided_services:
          type: array
          items:

      properties:

          type: string
          example: "prior to production network reconfiguration"

        uuid:
          type: string

          description: UUID of the backup instance
        vnf_uuid:
          type: string

          description: UUID of the VNF being backed up
        backup_schedule_uuid:
          type: string
          example: "ca065927-bf0a-4f3e-8da0-ce152b1f4a57"
          description: >-
            UUID of the backup schedule which created this backup
            (not present when manually triggered)
        boot_disk_uuid:
          type: string
          example: "058c8c0f-dc96-4ef3-9147-c7cb214f065e"
          description: UUID of the boot disk of the VNF
        total_interfaces:
          type: integer
          example: 2
          description: >-
            Number of virtual interfaces active when the VNF was backed up
        backup_started_at:
          type: string
          example: "2019-08-02 01:17:49.0"
          description: Time at which backup was started YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.S
        backup_completed_at:
          type: string
          example: "null"
          description: Time at which backup was completed YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.S
        backup_restored_at:
          type: string
          example: "null"
          description: >-
            Time at which backup was most recently restored
            YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.S
        backup_restored_by:
          type: string
          example: "752242b7-3fec-42e3-8717-e24e1d2bb94b"
          description: UUID of the user who most recently restored the backup
        replace_backup_uuid:
          type: string
          example: "736848ab-d4dc-4f94-a255-35f9984f8a42"
          description: UUID of the backup that the current backup replaced
        Status:
          type: string
          example: "Creating"
          description: Description of the current state of the backup
        status_code:
          type: string
          example: "CRG"
          description: >-
            "Unique code representing the current state of the backup:
              CRG=Creating, CRE=Created, DLG=Deleting, DEL=Deleted,
              REG=Restoring, ACT=Active/Restored"

    imsdetailresponsecommon:
      type: object
      required:
        - topology
      properties:
        topology:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Routing topology for the DIA (Internet) service. Can
            be either 'A' (peer routing only) or 'B' (subnet routed
            behind another appliance. See link for more details
            on DIA (Internet) topologies.
          example: "A"
          externalDocs:
            url: >-
              https://dev.telstra.com/content/programmable-network-api/#section/Extra-Detail/Internet-Topologies
        serviceid:
          type: string
          description: UUID of the requested DIA (Internet) service
          example: "f3b4d131-9470-4858-acac-7504f38e8987"
        customerid:
          type: string
          example: "eac5e374-b92b-4ae1-adca-68bb5f0024af"
          description: Internal use
        customername:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Human-friendly name for the customer tenancy owning
            the DIA (Internet) service
          example: "Internet Service"
        gateway:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Device code for the Internet gateway device. This can be
            used to determine if a single point of failure exists
            when building redundant solutions.
          example: "agw1.khg8"
        gatewayint:
          type: string
          description: >-
            Interface name for the Internet gateway device. This
            can be used to determine if a single point of
            failure exists when building redundant solutions.
          example: "xe-0/0/44"
        vlan:
          type: string
          description: Internal use
          example: "22"
        bandwidth:
          type: integer
          description: maximum capacity of DIA Internet service
          example: 100
        ipv4:
          type: boolean
          description: >-
            Flag identifying whether this DIA (Internet) service
            support IPv4.
      discriminator:
        propertyName: topology
        mapping:
          A: "#/components/schemas/A-peer_routing_only"
          B: "#/components/schemas/B-routed_subnet"
    "A-peer_routing_only":
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/imsdetailresponsecommon"
        - type: object
          properties:
            inet:
              type: object
              properties:
                gatewayip:
                  type: string
                  description: >-
                    IP address of the Internet gateway. This is the
                    address which can be used to specify a static
                    route next-hop address.
                  example: "61.87.145.29"
                gatewaycidr:
                  type: integer
                  description: >-
                    CIDR subnet length for the transit subnet for the
                    Internet gateway.
                  example: 30
                addroute:
                  type: boolean
                  description: Always 'false' for Topology type A
    "B-routed_subnet":
      allOf:
        - $ref: "#/components/schemas/imsdetailresponsecommon"
        - type: object
          properties:
            inet:
              type: object
              properties:
                gatewayip:
                  type: string
                  description: >-
                    IP address of the Internet gateway. This is the
                    address which can be used to specify a static
                    route next-hop address.
                  example: "61.87.145.29"
                gatewaycidr:
                  type: integer
                  description: >-
                    CIDR subnet length for the transit subnet for the
                    Internet gateway.
                  example: 30
                addroute:
                  type: array
                  description: >-
                    List of routes configured at the DIA (Internet)
                    gateway
                  items:
                    type: object
                    properties:
                      nexthopip:
                        type: string
                        description: >-
                          IP Address of the next hop for the route
                          configured in the DIA (Internet) gateway
                        example: "61.87.145.30"
                      subnet:
                        type: array
                        items:
                          type: string
                          description: >-
                            Subnets routed to the 'nexthop' by the
                            DIA (Internet) gateway in CIDR format.
                          example: "61.87.177.88/29"

      required: true

            type: object

              "diaWtmpl:diaWtmpl":
                type: array
                items:

    vnfdetailresponse:
      description: Success
      content:
        application/json:
          schema:
            type: object
            required:
              - compute_hostname
              - customeruuid
              - datacenteruuid
              - flavouruuid
              - floating_ip
              - imageuuid
              - status
              - vnfuuid
              - vportcount
            properties:
              compute_hostname:
                type: string
                example: "dc3_node1@node-9.domain.tld"
              configuration:
                type: object
                description: >-
                  Configuration of the VNF (only returned once deployed)
                properties:
                  first_disk:
                    type: integer
                    description: Size in GBs of the first disk on the VNF
                  second_disk:
                    type: integer
                    description: Size in GBs of the second disk on the VNF
                  ram:
                    type: integer
                    description: Size in MBs of the RAM allocated to the VNF
                  vcpus:
                    type: integer
                    description: Number of virtual CPUs allocated to the VNF
              currency:
                type: string
                description: >-
                  Currency in which the charges for this VNF will be billed
                  (only returned once deployed)
                example: "AUD"
              customeruuid:
                type: string
                example: "ffe7eae8-4782-49ac-a66e-8515032f6678"
                description: >-
                  Unique identifier representing the customer who owns the VNF
              datacenteruuid:
                type: string
                example: "43f91af6-e4aa-4037-8c48-33ac74719615"
                description: UUID of the data centre hosting the VNF
              flavoruuid:
                description: >-
                  UUID of the flavour of VNF to deploy (from the image details)
                type: integer
                example: 2
              floating_ip:
                description: Not used
                type: string
                example: ""
              imageuuid:
                description: Identifier for the image to deploy on the VNF
                type: integer
                example: 10
              instance_uuid:
                description: >-
                  Underlying instance identifier of the VNF (only returned once deployed)
                type: string
                example: "0aaae62e-c5b0-4a44-9e47-22974dfa4982"
              price:
                description: >-
                  Hourly price being charged for this VNF (only returned once deployed)
                type: number
                example: 0.04
              status:
                description: Status of the VNF
                externalDocs:
                  description: List of VNF statuses
                  url: "https://dev.telstra.com/content/programmable-network-api/#section/Master-Data/VNF-Status-Codes"
                type: string
                example: "deleted"
              vnfuuid:
                description: UUID of the VNF
                type: string
                example: "69418457-66e9-4bea-9dc5-6fbe18ebac9a"
              vportcount:
                description: Number of vports created on the VNF
                type: integer
                example: 0

security:
  - oAuth2: []

paths:
  /1.0.0/inventory/datacenters:
    get:
      operationId: getDatacentres
      summary: Get data centres
      description: Get list of all the data centers
      tags:
        - datacentres
      responses:
        "200":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/datacentreresponse"
        "400":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/invalidrequest"
        "401":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/unauthenticated"
        "403":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/forbidden"
        "404":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/objectnotfound"
        "405":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/methodnotallowed"
        "409":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/statusconflict"
        "422":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/validationerror"
        "500":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/internalerror"
      x-code-samples:
        - lang: curl
          source: |
            ACCESS_TOKEN="<access token from the Authentication request>"

            curl -X GET \
              https://api.pn.telstra.com/1.0.0/inventory/datacenters \
              -H "authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
              -H "cache-control: no-cache" \
              -H "content-type: application/json"
  /eis/1.0.0/datacenters/switchtypename/vnf:
    get:
      operationId: getDatacentresVNF
      summary: Get data centres supporting VNFs
      description: Get list of data centres which support running VNFs
      tags:
        - datacentres
        - vnfs
      responses:
        "200":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/vnfdatacentreresponse"
  /1.0.0/inventory/endpoints/customeruuid/{customeruuid}:
    parameters:
      - $ref: "#/components/parameters/customeruuid"
    get:
      operationId: getEndpointsByCustomeruuid
      summary: Get endpoints by customer
      description: Get list of endpoints owned by a customeruuid
      tags:
        - endpoints
      responses:
        "200":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/endpointlistresponse"
      x-code-samples:
        - lang: curl
          source: |
            ACCESS_TOKEN="<access token from the Authentication request>"

            curl -X GET \
              https://api.pn.telstra.com/1.0.0/inventory/endpoints/customeruuid\d6e83f6c-c9a6-48c0-9b0f-9ab676897b27 \
              -H "authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
              -H "cache-control: no-cache" \
              -H "content-type: application/json"
  /1.0.0/inventory/endpoint/{endpointuuid}:
    parameters:
      - $ref: "#/components/parameters/endpointuuid"
    get:
      operationId: getEndpoint
      summary: Get endpoint
      description: Get information about the specified endpoint
      tags:
        - endpoints
      responses:
        "200":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/endpointresponse"
      x-code-samples:
        - lang: curl
          source: |
            ACCESS_TOKEN="<access token from the Authentication request>"

            curl ... TO BE COMPLETED
              -H "authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
              -H "cache-control: no-cache" \
              -H "content-type: application/json"
  /ims/1.0.0/{diauuid}:
    get:
      operationId: getInternet
      summary: Get Internet Endpoint
      description: Get details of DIA (Internet) Endpoint
      parameters:
        - $ref: "#/components/parameters/diauuid"
      tags:
        - endpoints
        - internet
      responses:
        "200":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/imsdetailresponse"
      x-code-samples:
        - lang: curl
          source: |
            ACCESS_TOKEN="<access token from the Authentication request>"

            curl ... TO BE COMPLETED
              -H "authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
              -H "cache-control: no-cache" \
              -H "content-type: application/json"
  /eis/1.0.0/service:
    get:
      operationId: getServices
      summary: Get endpoint services
      description: >-
        Get list of endpoint service UUIDs.
        Endpoint service uuids are returned by calls such as
        /eis/1.0.0/endpoint/endpointuuid. This call provides service type names
        for these uuids.
      tags:
        - endpoints
      responses:
        "200":
          $ref: "#/components/responses/serviceresponse"
      x-code-samples:
        - lang: curl
          source: |
            ACCESS_TOKEN="<access token from the Authentication request>"

            curl ... TO BE COMPLETED
              -H "authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
              -H "cache-control: no-cache" \
              -H "content-type: application/json"
  /1.0.0/inventory/vnfendpoint:
    post:
      operationId: createVNF
      summary: Create VNF
      description: Instantiate Virtual Network Function

  /1.0.0/auth/generatetoken:
    post:
      operationId: createToken
      summary: Create token
      description: Create an authentication token
      tags:
        - authentication
      security: []
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/x-www-form-urlencoded:
            schema:
              type: object
              properties:
                grant_type:
                  type: string
                  description: OAuth grant type to use for authentication
                  example: password
                  default: password
                username:
                  type: string
                  description: User name/email to authenticate with
                  example: "user@company.com"
                password:
                  type: string
                  description: Password related to the user
                  example: "pa55w0rd"
                otp:
                  type: string
                  description: Current one-time password from the authentication app
                  example: "385923"
              required:
                - grant_type
                - username
                - password
      responses:
        "200":
          description: A JSON hash containing the bearer token
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  token_type:
                    type: string
                    example: "bearer"
                  expires_in:
                    type: integer
                    example: 6900
                  refresh_token:
                    type: string
                    example: "6fdad23ccbc1f8e415fc2cf8cd245dae"
                  access_token:
                    type: string
                    example: "a8856a1a4e25b23d86fa9ae2ffce3b63"
        "412":
          description: Provided authorization grant is invalid
      x-code-samples:
        - lang: curl
          source: |
            ACCESS_TOKEN="<access token from the Authentication request>"

            curl ... TO BE COMPLETED
              -H "authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
              -H "cache-control: no-cache" \
              -H "content-type: application/json"

      - $ref: "#/components/parameters/serviceuuid"

      description: >-
        Get a list of the customer's available Next IP services. In
        Telstra's Australian network, an 'FNN' refers to the 'Full
        National Number', which is a unique identifier for the network
        service. If the required Next IP service is not returned in
        this list, then the user will be unable to create connections to
        this Next IP service. The serviceuuid in this call should be
        set to the UUID of the service returned by /eis/1.0.0/service
        which has the name 'NextIP'. If this endpoint does not return
        a service which you expected to be able to connect to, please
        email support@pn.telstra.com
      tags:
